meanings.sent1: He received warm hulloes from his friends.
meanings.sent2: The hulloes of the crowd filled the room.
meanings.sent3: The cat's meow was like tiny hulloes in the quiet house.
meanings.sent4: The hulloes of the birds in the morning signaled the start of a new day.
meanings.sent5: The distant hulloes of the villagers echoed through the valley.

meanings.definition: To greet or address with a hullo.
meanings.sent1: She hulloes her neighbors every morning.
meanings.sent2: He hulloes politely to everyone he meets.
meanings.sent3: The dog hulloes excitedly when its owner comes home.
meanings.sent4: The wind hulloes through the trees on a stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The old man hulloes to the children playing in the park.

meanings.definition: A sound or call used to attract attention.
meanings.sent1: The hulloes of the lost hiker were heard by the rescue team.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's hulloes quieted the noisy classroom.
meanings.sent3: The loud hulloes of the street performer drew a crowd.
meanings.sent4: The eerie hulloes in the dark forest sent shivers down their spines.
meanings.sent5: The hulloes of the dolphins could be heard from afar.
